prehistory.text:
Secrets of the Virgin Island.

A big island. Local people call it Ko Rou, which means 'Strong and powerful' .

Legends and superstition, local customs and prophecies.

Local people believe in stories having been told from deneration to another.

Rich and powerful businessmen, who don't believe

in local "stupid" to their minds superstitions, came to his land to conquer it and

build up with attractions and facilities for tourists. Bounty hunters who know something more

about the island, try to find hidden treasures deep in its caves. Tourists who came here on thier

holiday have no idea what they are to find out about the mysterious Virgin Island!

What can be better then to spend a sunny day on an exotic island, hidden in the warm waters of the osean? You'll see peaceful and wild scenery, spectacular sunset above the clear water, waterfalls and caves, hidden in the wild forests.

A sheduled boat full of tourists arrived today early in the morning to the southern part of the Virgin Island.

They were led by a guide, who showed them wild forest, caves and waterfalls around the area where they stopped.

They planned to spend the rest of the day snorkinling, swimming in a bay and sunbathing on a deserted beach.

Later in the evening a boatman must have come and collected them. But he didn't show up. It's already getting dark and people start being really anxious.

Few hours later one of the torists, Ryan, found the boatman's body with a knife in his back, near a waterfall in the forest. When he told other people what he saw, they

all rushed there, but there was no body at all. Not even a trace of.

Is anyone coming to collect them?

Where killed the boatman and why?

Will they be left here alone forever?

What secrets is this Island keeping?

Is it hiding the truth from us?
